rocks.bastion.core.view

Interface ResponseDecoder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonResponseDecoder, StringResponseDecoder

    public interface ResponseDecoder
    Interprets and decodes an HTTP response into a model object. Bastion will ask ResponseDecoders to decode the HTTP response if possible. A typical implementation will first look at the response's Content-type header and attempt to generate some sort of object. If the decoder is unable to decode the HTTP response into a Java object (because it cannot interpret the given Content-type, for example), then then it should return an empty Bindings object.

    Once registered with Bastion, the ResponseDecoders will form a strategy for turning an arbitrary HTTP response to a number of usable Java object (so-called views) available in Bastion tests and assertions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Bindings decode(Response response, DecodingHints hints)
      Attempts to decode the given HTTP response to a number of Java objects (ie.

    • Method Detail

      • decode

        Bindings decode(Response response,
                DecodingHints hints)
        Attempts to decode the given HTTP response to a number of Java objects (ie. views). If this decoder is unable to decode the HTTP response, then it should return an empty Bindings object. Otherwise, it should return bindings for all possible views of the given response.

        A user might have supplied a target object type it wants the decoded information bound to. In this case, the target model type to bind to will be given in the hints parameter, accessible using the DecodingHints.getModelType() method.

        Parameters:
        response - The HTTP response for the converter to decode
        hints - Additional hints which can be used for decoding the provided response
        Returns:
        A non-null Bindings object
